original: BraKme, Bengt Leonard, lasarettsläkare, Norrköping, f. 8/7/92 i Virke, Malmöii. I. G. 23 m. Anna Lisa Pfan-nenstill. Barn: Margareta f. 25, Gunilla 28. — Studiex. 10, med. kand. 13, med. lic. 18 o. med. dr 23, allt i Lund. Utr. stud:res. årl. 23-37. E. läk. v. Orupssanat. två mån. 16-17, aman. v. anatom. inst. i Lund 18, v. Lunds las. med. klin. fem mån. 18-19, und:läk. där 19-22, aman. v. pediatr. klin. i Lund 23, v. klin. f. bröstsjukd. 24-25, klin. laborator v. Lunds las. 25-27, docent i prakt. med. v. Lunds univ. 23-27, las :läk. v. Norrköp. las. med. avd. sed. 27. Sekr. i Sv. internförb. 29-40, ordf. sed. 41, ordf. ,i Sv. fören. f. inv. med. 47, .styr :led. i Sv. ilas:läk:-fören. 33-39, fullm. i Sv. läkiförb., led. av stadsfullm. i Norrköp. sed. 30, in-neh. även ett flert. andra komm. upp-dr. Skr.: ett 50-tal avhandl. o. upps. i inv. med. Hobbies: böcker, golf. RNO, Svcfi förtj:M, östergötl. idr:-förb. idr :GM, Sv. golfförb. förtj :plak.
translated: BraKme, Bengt Leonard, hospital doctor, Norrköping, b. 8/7/92 in Virke, Malmöii. Married to Anna Lisa Pfannenstill in 1923. Children: Margareta b. 1925, Gunilla b. 1928. He completed his studies in 1910 and obtained a Bachelor of Medicine degree in 1913, a Medical Licentiate in 1918 and a Doctor of Medicine in 1923, all from Lund University. He went on annual study trips abroad from 1923-1937. He was an assistant physician at Orupssanat for two months in 1916-1917, an assistant at the Anatomy Institute in Lund in 1918, worked at Lund's hospital medical clinic for five months in 1918-1919, was a resident physician there from 1919-1922, an assistant at the Pediatric Clinic in Lund in 1923, at the Chest Disease Clinic from 1924-1925, and in the Clinical Laboratory at Lund's hospital from 1925-1927. He was a senior lecturer in practical medicine at Lund University from 1923-1927, and chief physician at Norrköping hospital's medical department since 1927. He was the Secretary of the Swedish International Association from 1929-1940, the Chairman from 1941, the Chairman of the Swedish Society for Internal Medicine in 1947, member of the board of the Swedish Hospital Physicians Association from 1933-1939, a full member of the Swedish Medical Association, a member of the city council of Norrköping since 1930, and also held several other municipal positions. He has written around 50 studies on internal medicine and enjoys reading and golfing. He has been awarded the Royal Order of the North Star, the Swedish Sports Confederation's Medal of Merit, and the Östergötland Sports Association's Sports Badge.

structured.description: Bengt Leonard BraKme was a Swedish hospital doctor at Norrköping Hospital. He was born on July 8th, 1892 in Virke, Malmöii. He studied at Lund University and completed his education with a Bachelor of Medicine in 1913, a Medical Licentiate in 1918, and a Doctor of Medicine in 1923. He was actively engaged in various organizations such as the Swedish International Association, Swedish Society for Internal Medicine, Swedish Hospital Physicians Association, Swedish Medical Association, and Norrköping City Council, among others. Bengt Leonard BraKme had a keen interest in internal medicine, and he authored several research papers on the topic. Additionally, he enjoyed reading and playing golf.
